channel.title: Java path - SCREWED!
channel.description:
My peice of shit computer doesn't want to comply with my compiler. My compiler to compile MoparScape is seriously messing up... My classpaths are screwed. I have JDK version 5 update 7 and my paths are as follows in the environmental settings in MY COMPUTER...
Variable name: Classpath Variable Value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\
Variable name: path Variable Value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\
And my compiler's settings are set to this -
@echo off title Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
Now I need help on how the hell to fix this... I know that it's not not working because of my JDK version, because it has before, but I don't know what to do. [b]So help if you could, please?[/b] Thank you for reading this blasphemic topic, community of moparisthebest.com. I love you.

item.title: Java path - SCREWED!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

  1. that is not your compiler. The compiler is Javac.exe.
  2. You aren’t even using your environment variables in the batch file. It should look something like this:

@echo off javac *.java pause

  1. Don’t mention Moparscape unless you want teh flame and/or redirection to moparisthebest.com from every person with some common sense.

Read full topic
